questions.title: Why This Company?
questions.prompt: Why do you want to work for {company}? Be specific about what excites you (product, culture, problems, growth).
followups: What specific team or area would you be excited to join, and why?
What’s one value of {company} that resonates with you?

questions.title: Why Are You Leaving?
questions.prompt: Why do you want to leave your current/last company or role? Keep it professional and growth-focused.
followups: What are you looking for that you can’t get in your current role?
What did you learn from your current/last role?

questions.title: What Are You Looking For Next?
questions.prompt: What are you looking for in your next role? Talk about scope, learning, mentorship, impact, and collaboration.
followups: What kind of work energizes you the most?
What environment helps you do your best work?

questions.title: Conflict With a Coworker
questions.prompt: Tell me about a time when you had a conflict with a coworker. What happened and how did you resolve it?
followups: What would you do differently next time?
How did you ensure the relationship stayed productive?

questions.title: Influencing Others
questions.prompt: Tell me about a time you had a conflict and needed to influence somebody else. How did you approach it?
followups: How did you build trust or alignment?
What data or reasoning helped you convince them?

questions.title: Current Project
questions.prompt: What project are you currently working on (or most recently worked on)? Summarize the goal, your role, and impact.
followups: What trade-offs did you make and why?
How did you measure success?

questions.title: Most Challenging Aspect
questions.prompt: What is the most challenging aspect of your current/most recent project?
followups: How did you break the problem down?
What did you learn from dealing with it?

questions.title: Hard Bug You Fixed
questions.prompt: What was the most difficult bug you fixed recently? Walk through how you diagnosed it and the final fix.
followups: How did you validate the fix and prevent regressions?
What tools helped you the most?

questions.title: Tough Challenge
questions.prompt: Tell me about a difficult challenge you faced on a project, how you overcame it, and what you learned.
followups: What was the key decision that helped you succeed?
How did you communicate progress to others?

questions.title: What Excites You?
questions.prompt: What are you excited about right now (technology, product area, learning goal)?
followups: How have you been pursuing that interest?
How does it relate to this role?

questions.title: What Frustrates You?
questions.prompt: What frustrates you at work, and how do you handle it constructively?
followups: How do you prevent frustration from impacting the team?
Give an example of turning frustration into an improvement.

questions.title: First Day at {company}
questions.prompt: Imagine it is your first day at {company}. What do you want to work on? What feature would you improve and why?
followups: How would you validate the problem with users or data?
How would you measure success?

questions.title: Most Interesting Projects
questions.prompt: What are the most interesting projects you have worked on, and how might they be relevant to {company}?
followups: What was your specific contribution?
What did you learn that you’d apply again?

questions.title: Disagreement With Manager
questions.prompt: Tell me about a time you had a disagreement with your manager. How did you handle it?
followups: How did you keep it constructive and respectful?
What was the outcome?

questions.title: Project You're Passionate About
questions.prompt: Talk about a project you are most passionate about or one where you did your best work.
followups: What made it meaningful to you?
What would you improve if you had more time?

questions.title: Best Day of Work
questions.prompt: What does your best day of work look like? Describe the environment, tasks, and collaboration style.
followups: How do you create more days like that for yourself and your team?
What habits help you be productive?

questions.title: Pushing for Something
questions.prompt: Tell me about something you had to push for in a previous project (a decision, improvement, or change).
followups: How did you build alignment?
What did you learn about influencing without authority?

questions.title: Constructive Feedback
questions.prompt: What is the most constructive feedback you have received, and how did you apply it?
followups: What changed as a result?
How do you ask for feedback proactively?

questions.title: Perseverance Over Months
questions.prompt: Tell me about something you had to persevere at for multiple months. How did you stay motivated?
followups: What was the hardest moment and how did you handle it?
What did you learn about yourself?

questions.title: Tight Deadline
questions.prompt: Tell me about a time you met a tight deadline. How did you plan and execute?
followups: What trade-offs did you make?
How did you communicate risk and progress?

questions.title: First Annual Review
questions.prompt: If this were your first annual review at {company}, what would I be telling you right now? (strengths + areas to improve)
followups: What would you do in the first 90 days to be successful?
How do you measure your own growth?

questions.title: Time Management Skill
questions.prompt: Give an example of a time-management skill you've learned and applied at work or school.
followups: What changed after you applied it?
How do you prioritize when everything feels urgent?

questions.title: Getting Along With an Associate
questions.prompt: Tell me about a problem you've had getting along with a work associate. What did you do to improve the situation?
followups: How did you ensure the work still got done?
What did you learn about communication styles?

questions.title: Work Criticized Most Often
questions.prompt: What aspects of your work are most often criticized? How have you addressed it?
followups: What concrete steps did you take?
How do you track improvement?

questions.title: Handling Criticism
questions.prompt: How have you handled criticism of your work? Give a specific example.
followups: How do you separate feedback from emotion?
How do you respond when you disagree?

questions.title: Strengths for the Role
questions.prompt: What strengths do you think are most important for this role, and which of those are your strengths?
followups: Give an example of using that strength on a project.
What strength are you currently working to improve?

questions.title: How Colleagues Describe You
questions.prompt: What words would your colleagues or classmates use to describe you? Give evidence for each.
followups: What feedback have you received that supports this?
How do you want to be known on a team?

questions.title: First Six Months Goals
questions.prompt: What would you hope to achieve in the first six months after being hired at {company}?
followups: How would you learn the codebase quickly?
How would you build relationships across the team?

questions.title: Why You're a Good Fit
questions.prompt: Tell me why you will be a good fit for this position. Connect your experience to the role requirements.
followups: What is one gap you’re working on right now?
What’s an example that demonstrates your fit?

questions.title: Dealing with Ambiguity
questions.prompt: Tell me about a time you had to work on a project with unclear requirements or goals. How did you proceed?
followups: How did you seek clarity and define success?
What steps did you take to manage uncertainty?

questions.title: Mentoring Others
questions.prompt: Describe a time you mentored or helped a junior colleague or teammate grow their skills.
followups: How did you assess what they needed?
What was the outcome for them and for the team?

questions.title: Learning New Technology
questions.prompt: Tell me about a time you had to quickly learn a new technology or framework for a project.
followups: What was your learning strategy?
How did you apply it to deliver value quickly?

questions.title: Missed Deadline or Failure
questions.prompt: Tell me about a time you missed a deadline or a project didn't go as planned. What happened and what did you learn?
followups: How did you communicate the situation?
What would you do differently in hindsight?

questions.title: Improving a Process
questions.prompt: Describe a time you identified an inefficient process at work and improved it.
followups: How did you get buy-in from others?
How did you measure the impact of your change?

questions.title: Ethical Dilemma
questions.prompt: Have you ever faced an ethical dilemma at work? How did you handle it?
followups: What principles guided your decision?
Who did you consult with, if anyone?

questions.title: Receiving Conflicting Feedback
questions.prompt: Tell me about a time you received conflicting feedback from multiple stakeholders. How did you resolve it?
followups: How did you decide which direction to take?
How did you manage stakeholder expectations?

questions.title: Working with Remote Team
questions.prompt: Describe your experience working with a remote or distributed team. What challenges did you face and how did you overcome them?
followups: What tools or practices helped most?
How did you build rapport with teammates you rarely saw in person?

questions.title: Taking Initiative
questions.prompt: Give an example of a time you took initiative on a project beyond your assigned responsibilities.
followups: What was the outcome?
How did you balance this with your core responsibilities?

questions.title: Adapting to Change
questions.prompt: Tell me about a significant change in your team or company (reorg, pivot, new leadership). How did you adapt?
followups: How did you help others adapt?
What did you learn from the experience?

questions.title: Saying No to a Request
questions.prompt: Describe a time you had to say no to a request from a manager, stakeholder, or teammate. How did you handle it?
followups: How did you explain your reasoning?
What alternative did you propose, if any?

questions.title: Building Trust
questions.prompt: Tell me about a time you had to build trust with a new team or a skeptical stakeholder.
followups: What specific actions did you take?
How did you know trust had been established?

questions.title: Work-Life Balance
questions.prompt: How do you maintain a healthy work-life balance, especially during demanding projects?
followups: What boundaries do you set?
How do you recharge and avoid burnout?

questions.title: Presenting to Leadership
questions.prompt: Describe a time you had to present a complex technical topic to non-technical leadership or stakeholders.
followups: How did you tailor your message?
What was the outcome of the presentation?

questions.title: Cultural Fit
questions.prompt: How would you describe your work style, and what kind of team culture brings out your best performance?
followups: How do you contribute to a positive team culture?
What's your approach when you join a new team?

questions.title: Career Goals
questions.prompt: Where do you see your career in 3-5 years, and how does this role align with that vision?
followups: What skills are you looking to develop in that time?
How do you plan your professional development?
